t: Matthew 1
The*p book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
Abraham*p begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat Judah and his brethren;
And*p Judah begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;
And*p Aram begat Aminadab; and Aminadab begat Naasson; and Naasson begat Salmon;
And*p Salmon begat Booz of Rahab; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse;
And*p Jesse begat David the king; and David the king begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Urias;
And*p Solomon begat Roboam; and Roboam begat Abia; and Abia begat Asa;
And*p Asa begat Josaphat; and Josaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Ozias;
And*p Ozias begat Joatham; and Joatham begat Achaz; and Achaz begat Ezekias;
And*p Ezekias begat Manasses; and Manasses begat Amon; and Amon begat Josias;
And*p Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren, about the time they were carried away to Babylon:
And*p after they were brought to Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel;
And*p Zorobabel begat Abiud; and Abiud begat Eliakim; and Eliakim begat Azor;
And*p Azor begat Sadoc; and Sadoc begat Achim; and Achim begat Eliud;
And*p Eliud begat Eleazar; and Eleazar begat Matthan; and Matthan begat Jacob;
And*p Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

So*p all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; and from David until the carrying away into Babylon are fourteen generations; and from the carrying away into Babylon unto Christ are fourteen generations.
Now*p the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise: When as his mother Mary was espoused to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Ghost.
Then*p Joseph her husband, being a just man, and not willing to make her a publick example, was minded to put her away privily.

But*p while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream, saying, Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife: for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost.
And*p she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name JESUS: for he shall save his people from their sins.
Now*p all this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying,
Behold,*p a virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which being interpreted is, God with us.
Then*p Joseph being raised from sleep did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him, and took unto him his wife:
And*p knew her not till she had brought forth her firstborn son: and he called his name JESUS.
Matthew 2
Now*p when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,
Saying,*p Where is he that is born King of the Jews? for we have seen his star in the east, and are come to worship him.
When*p Herod the king had heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
And*p when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.
And*p they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea: for thus it is written by the prophet,
And*p thou Bethlehem, in the land of Juda, art not the least among the princes of Juda: for out of thee shall come a Governor, that shall rule my people Israel.
Then*p Herod, when he had privily called the wise men, enquired of them diligently what time the star appeared.
And*p he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have found him, bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also.
When*p they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.
When*p they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.

And*p when they were come into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother, and fell down, and worshipped him: and when they had opened their treasures, they presented unto him gifts; gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.
And*p being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.

And*p when they were departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I bring thee word: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.
When*p he arose, he took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt:
And*p was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.

Then*p Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently enquired of the wise men.
Then*p was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying,
In*p Rama was there a voice heard, lamentation, and weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children, and would not be comforted, because they are not.
But*p when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
Saying,*p Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead which sought the young child's life.
And*p he arose, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

But*p when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither: notwithstanding, being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the parts of Galilee:
And*p he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, He shall be called a Nazarene.
Matthew 3
In*p those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea,
And*p saying, Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
For*p this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Esaias, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
And*p the same John had his raiment of camel's hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins; and his meat was locusts and wild honey.
Then*p went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judaea, and all the region round about Jordan,
And*p were baptized of him in Jordan, confessing their sins.
But*p when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
Bring*p forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:
And*p think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
And*p now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
I*p indeed baptize you with water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost, and with fire:
Whose*p fan is in his hand, and he will thoroughly purge his floor, and gather his wheat into the garner; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.
Then*p cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John, to be baptized of him.
But*p John forbad him, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?
And*p Jesus answering said unto him, Suffer*r it*r to*r be*r so*r now:*r for*r thus*r it*r becometh*r us*r to*r fulfil*r all*r righteousness.*r Then he suffered him.
And*p Jesus, when he was baptized, went up straightway out of the water: and, lo, the heavens were opened unto him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and lighting upon him:
And*p lo a voice from heaven, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
Matthew 4
Then*p was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil.
And*p when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward an hungred.
And*p when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.
But*p he answered and said, It*r is*r written,*r Man*r shall*r not*r live*r by*r bread*r alone,*r but*r by*r every*r word*r that*r proceedeth*r out*r of*r the*r mouth*r of*r God.*r
Then*p the devil taketh him up into the holy city, and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple,

And*p saith unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee: and in their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.
Jesus*p said unto him, It*r is*r written*r again,*r Thou*r shalt*r not*r tempt*r the*r Lord*r thy*r God.*r
Again,*p the devil taketh him up into an exceeding high mountain, and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them;
And*p saith unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.
Then*p saith Jesus unto him, Get*r thee*r hence,*r Satan:*r for*r it*r is*r written,*r Thou*r shalt*r worship*r the*r Lord*r thy*r God,*r and*r him*r only*r shalt*r thou*r serve.*r
Then*p the devil leaveth him, and, behold, angels came and ministered unto him.
Now*p when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison, he departed into Galilee;
And*p leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim:
That*p it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,
The*p land of Zabulon, and the land of Nephthalim, by the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles;
The*p people which sat in darkness saw great light; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up.
From*p that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, Repent:*r for*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r at*r hand.*r
And*p Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brethren, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.
And*p he saith unto them, Follow*r me,*r and*r I*r will*r make*r you*r fishers*r of*r men.*r
And*p they straightway left their nets, and followed him.
And*p going on from thence, he saw other two brethren, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.
And*p they immediately left the ship and their father, and followed him.
And*p Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people.

And*p his fame went throughout all Syria: and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those which were possessed with devils, and those which were lunatic, and those that had the palsy; and he healed them.
And*p there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee, and from Decapolis, and from Jerusalem, and from Judaea, and from beyond Jordan.
Matthew 5
And*p seeing the multitudes, he went up into a mountain: and when he was set, his disciples came unto him:
And*p he opened his mouth, and taught them, saying,

Blessed*rp are*r they*r which*r do*r hunger*r and*r thirst*r after*r righteousness:*r for*r they*r shall*r be*r filled.*r
Blessed*rp are*r the*r merciful:*r for*r they*r shall*r obtain*r mercy.*r
Blessed*rp are*r the*r pure*r in*r heart:*r for*r they*r shall*r see*r God.*r
Blessed*rp are*r the*r peacemakers:*r for*r they*r shall*r be*r called*r the*r children*r of*r God.*r
Blessed*rp are*r they*r which*r are*r persecuted*r for*r righteousness'*r sake:*r for*r theirs*r is*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven.*r

Ye*rp are*r the*r light*r of*r the*r world.*r A*r city*r that*r is*r set*r on*r an*r hill*r cannot*r be*r hid.*r

Whosoever*rp therefore*r shall*r break*r one*r of*r these*r least*r commandments,*r and*r shall*r teach*r men*r so,*r he*r shall*r be*r called*r the*r least*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven:*r but*r whosoever*r shall*r do*r and*r teach*r them,*r the*r same*r shall*r be*r called*r great*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven.*r

It*rp hath*r been*r said,*r Whosoever*r shall*r put*r away*r his*r wife,*r let*r him*r give*r her*r a*r writing*r of*r divorcement:*r

Again,*rp ye*r have*r heard*r that*r it*r hath*r been*r said*r by*r them*r of*r old*r time,*r Thou*r shalt*r not*r forswear*r thyself,*r but*r shalt*r perform*r unto*r the*r Lord*r thine*r oaths:*r
But*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Swear*r not*r at*r all;*r neither*r by*r heaven;*r for*r it*r is*r God's*r throne:*r

Matthew 6
Take*rp heed*r that*r ye*r do*r not*r your*r alms*r before*r men,*r to*r be*r seen*r of*r them:*r otherwise*r ye*r have*r no*r reward*r of*r your*r Father*r which*r is*r in*r heaven.*r

That*rp thine*r alms*r may*r be*r in*r secret:*r and*r thy*r Father*r which*r seeth*r in*r secret*r himself*r shall*r reward*r thee*r openly.*r

The*p governor answered and said unto them, Whether of the twain will ye that I release unto you? They said, Barabbas.

When*p Pilate saw that he could prevail nothing, but that rather a tumult was made, he took water, and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, I am innocent of the blood of this just person: see ye to it.

And*p when they were come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, a place of a skull,
They*p gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall: and when he had tasted thereof, he would not drink.

And*p they crucified him, and parted his garments, casting lots: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, They parted my garments among them, and upon my vesture did they cast lots.
And*p sitting down they watched him there;
And*p set up over his head his accusation written, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
Then*p were there two thieves crucified with him, one on the right hand, and another on the left.
And*p they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads,
And*p saying, Thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days, save thyself. If thou be the Son of God, come down from the cross.
Likewise*p also the chief priests mocking him, with the scribes and elders, said,
He*p saved others; himself he cannot save. If he be the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe him.
He*p trusted in God; let him deliver him now, if he will have him: for he said, I am the Son of God.
The*p thieves also, which were crucified with him, cast the same in his teeth.
Now*p from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour.
And*p about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eli,*r Eli,*r lama*r sabachthani?*r that is to say, My*r God,*r my*r God,*r why*r hast*r thou*r forsaken*r me?*r
Some*p of them that stood there, when they heard that, said, This man calleth for Elias.
And*p straightway one of them ran, and took a sponge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink.
The*p rest said, Let be, let us see whether Elias will come to save him.
Jesus,*p when he had cried again with a loud voice, yielded up the ghost.
And,*p behold, the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom; and the earth did quake, and the rocks rent;
And*p the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose,
And*p came out of the graves after his resurrection, and went into the holy city, and appeared unto many.
Now*p when the centurion, and they that were with him, watching Jesus, saw the earthquake, and those things that were done, they feared greatly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.
And*p many women were there beholding afar off, which followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him:
Among*p which was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee's children.
When*p the even was come, there came a rich man of Arimathaea, named Joseph, who also himself was Jesus' disciple:
He*p went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.
And*p when Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
And*p laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock: and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre, and departed.
And*p there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre.
Now*p the next day, that followed the day of the preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate,
Saying,*p Sir, we remember that that deceiver said, while he was yet alive, After*r three*r days*r I*r will*r rise*r again.*r

Command*p therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day, lest his disciples come by night, and steal him away, and say unto the people, He is risen from the dead: so the last error shall be worse than the first.
Pilate*p said unto them, Ye have a watch: go your way, make it as sure as ye can.
So*p they went, and made the sepulchre sure, sealing the stone, and setting a watch.
Matthew 28
In*p the end of the sabbath, as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week, came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre.

His*p countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow:

He*p is not here: for he is risen, as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.
And*p go quickly, and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead; and, behold, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him: lo, I have told you.
And*p they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy; and did run to bring his disciples word.
And*p as they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, All*r hail.*r And they came and held him by the feet, and worshipped him.
Then*p said Jesus unto them, Be*r not*r afraid:*r go*r tell*r my*r brethren*r that*r they*r go*r into*r Galilee,*r and*r there*r shall*r they*r see*r me.*r
Now*p when they were going, behold, some of the watch came into the city, and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done.
And*p when they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave large money unto the soldiers,
Saying,*p Say ye, His disciples came by night, and stole him away while we slept.
And*p if this come to the governor's ears, we will persuade him, and secure you.
So*p they took the money, and did as they were taught: and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day.
Then*p the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them.
And*p when they saw him, they worshipped him: but some doubted.
And*p Jesus came and spake unto them, saying, All*r power*r is*r given*r unto*r me*r in*r heaven*r and*r in*r earth.*r
Go*rp ye*r therefore,*r and*r teach*r all*r nations,*r baptizing*r them*r in*r the*r name*r of*r the*r Father,*r and*r of*r the*r Son,*r and*r of*r the*r Holy*r Ghost:*r
Teaching*rp them*r to*r observe*r all*r things*r whatsoever*r I*r have*r commanded*r you:*r and,*r lo,*r I*r am*r with*r you*r alway,*r even*r unto*r the*r end*r of*r the*r world.*r Amen.*r
